description: A densely forested island usually shrouded in fog beneath an overcast sky, featuring distinctive mountain-like hills whose peaks curve inward. Once home to the Shikkearu Kingdom, which fell after a devastating war nine years before the current story. The island now hosts ruins and a central castle built partially over a small lake, serving as Dracule Mihawk's home.
notableFeatures: Giant cross-shaped gravestone marking the fallen Shikkearu Kingdom
Mihawk's castle built over a lake
Dense forests inhabited by weapon-wielding Humandrills
Ruins of the destroyed kingdom scattered across the island

keyEvents.title: Perona Returns Zoro's Swords
keyEvents.description: In Mihawk's castle, Perona gives Zoro back his swords after growing frustrated with his poor navigation skills.

keyEvents.title: Discovery of the Giant Gravestone
keyEvents.description: Zoro and Perona discover the enormous cross-shaped gravestone that marks the fallen Shikkearu Kingdom, a remnant of the war fought nine years prior.

keyEvents.title: Humandrill Encounter
keyEvents.description: Weapon-wielding Humandrills emerge from the forest and attack Zoro near the giant gravestone.

statusHistory.description: Before the war nine years prior
After the war destroyed the kingdom
Mihawk takes residence in the castle

trivia: The Humandrills learned their weapon skills by observing the war that destroyed the Shikkearu Kingdom
The island's perpetual gloom gave it the nickname 'Gloom Island'
Mihawk chose this isolated location as his home after the kingdom fell

description: A fairly barren landscape with dry soil and grasslands, interrupted by numerous scattered clusters of jagged rocks and a few trees. Buildings are constructed in feudal Japanese style and appear dilapidated throughout the region. Home to the nation of Harahettania, also known as the 'Land of Poverty'.
notableFeatures: Harahettania - the impoverished nation on the island
Barren, dry landscape with scattered rocks

keyEvents.title: Brook Learns of the Debt
keyEvents.description: The people of Harahettania explain to Brook their desire to repay the debt of gratitude for his help against the Longarm Tribe.

keyEvents.title: Brook's Decision to Stay
keyEvents.description: Brook decides to remain on the island to help the people before reuniting with his crew, demonstrating his honorable character.

keyEvents.title: Brook's Panty Request
keyEvents.description: Brook uses his status as the supposed summoned Satan to request to see women's underwear, providing comic relief.

statusHistory.description: After Brook helps defeat the Longarm Tribe

trivia: The name 'Namakura' means 'lazy' or 'cowardly' in Japanese, referencing the inhabitants' initial passiveness
Harahettania translates to 'Land of Poverty', with 'hara hetta' meaning 'I'm hungry' in Japanese
The island was controlled by a Satan-worshiping cult led by Pekkori
Brook arrived during a demon-summoning ritual, leading the people to believe they had successfully summoned Satan
